jsx.http.event
Class HTTPState<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source.Event<T>
              jsx.http.event.HTTPState<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTTPAborted, HTTPLoaded, HTTPOpen, HTTPReceiving, HTTPSent
public abstract class HTTPState<T>
extends Source.Event<T>

An abstract type of high level events that may be fired from a Ajax object to notify a state of HTTP transmission.

This class is designed generic with the type parameter being the type of its corresponding listener type. A subclass must be concrete and final if it is to be an event type. As an event type, the subclass must also declare the type parameter of this class as the type of its own listener.

An event listener is typically of an interface with a declared method to react on the event it handles so that the class of the event can implement the Source.Event.execute(Object) method by simply calling that declared method passing the event itself as the argument. A subclass of this class defines events uniquely typed by the subclass itself and designates a listener type corresponding to that type of events.

For an event source to fire an event, the listener of the event must have been registered onto the source object with a call to the Source.addListener(Class, Object) method which asks both the type of the event and the listener object for arguments.

Note that, high level events are Configurable.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Constructor Detail

HTTPState

protected HTTPState()

The default constructor which simply invokes the default constructor of the superclass.

Note that, this constructor does not change the configurable properties Source.Event.BUBBLE and Source.Event.UPDATE of this event object.

Since:
1.0
Method Detail

getSource

public static final Ajax getSource(HTTPState<?> evt)

Gets the source object of an event of this type.

This method simply returns the configurable property Source.Event.SOURCE of the specified event.

Parameters:
evt - The event to get source.
Returns:
The source of the specified event. This method returns null if the event has not been fired. Fire a fired event is meaningless.
Since:
1.0
